course.name: English for University Studies II
course.description: The course builds on LANG 1002 and aims to further develop students' proficiency in English as well as their academic literacy skills, so that they can cope with the linguistic demands of studying through the medium of English. The course aims to develop students' competence in reading and writing, as well as the ability to engage in oral interaction in social and academic contexts. For students under the four-year degree curriculum.
course.exclusions: IELTS - Band 7 or above in overall and Band 6.5 or above in each part of the test or equivalent

reviews.comment_content:
beauty and happiness, many breakout room activities for writing and speaking practices. Reading materials are provided as reference during class time / on canvas. It is quite hard when you group with boys as they are too quiet, dead air for so many times haha but luckily my groupmates all girls in elpa speaking assessment! Role-playing like devil advocate is interesting to put theory into practice.

Reading Paper & Writing Paper: 80 minutes
Speaking Test: 5 minutes an adapted version of Part 1: only Question 2 (compare and contrast) & Question 3 (giving opinions), and
Part 2 (suggesting solutions).

Elpa(online this year) is a closed book exam just dun rely on other source. Speaking(modified version so only type 2 &3 compare contrast/ opinion) : 1 min impromptu speech+ 1 mins immediate response +2mins short speaking(1 mins prep time), just like DSE for the 1 min part. Word limit of writing is 300 words and pretty straightforward, no need to revise a lot for elpa if you listen to Rosita's instructions. I didn't use complicate words neither for my speaking nor writing but the fluency and variation matter.
reviews.comment_teaching: passionate teacher, Rosita is well-prepared and try to make our class engaging, if you pay attention in class like remarks for essay citation, punctation and try to use some skills taught in class, then you will be alright. Just follow the steps she requires/expects you to do in your essay like TS->primary explanation->citation  -> secondary explanation -> sc to organise your essay in a systematic way.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair enough, don't be scared, it is not that bad. No idea abt my elpa, just have my elpa reading: 18/26 and essay marks, 4545(1) so it is out of my surprise that I have A-!!! :O I attend every lecture so put your best foot forward, no sweat abt your grade. Elpa is similar to ielts I guess. Good luck and hope you all enjoy Rosita's class! She is a good tutor.

- organizing writing
- synthesis of info from sources
- practice synthesizing and citing
- supporting arguments
- presenting individually and in groups; giving
  feedback

blog 1: Summary and critique of an article (e.g., magazines, journals)
blog 2: Comparison/critique/synthesis of 2 more articles

Sem尾交multimodal project(6-8 mins video)

1. Speaking task = a solution to a problem (3-4 mins video)
2. Writing task = reflection on multimodal communication in your group project (300 words)
3. Looking forward task = evaluating progress and setting new goals (300 words)

reviews.author: Tokumei
reviews.comment_content:
This course will focus on developing students’ academic literacy skills for university studies, while continuing to enhance their language proficiency. Key features of the teaching materials, student activities, and assessments will be self-directed learning, communication within a team, and multimodal communication. With the focus on academic literacy, this course introduces students to research skills for finding and evaluating sources for academic writing and speaking tasks. It expects students to be critical in their reading and writing, as they organize, substantiate and synthesize ideas when developing coherent and strong arguments. Collaboration and leadership skills will also be emphasized to further develop skills and habits for autonomous lifelong learning.

LANG 1003's assessments include the following:

70% of the grade for a multimodal project, which is broken down into several steps
30% of the grade for self-directed learning
In the table below, you can see the general timeline for the assessments.

The multimodal project will begin with 3-4 students making a group and selecting one of the research topics. The group will next write a team contract. The 10-week research projects continues with library research, two academic blogs, a draft of the video in the "storyboard" session, consultations, and a final presentation (see details in the Assessments area of Canvas).

The Self-Directed Learning includes the online/blended learning work (including the library workshop), the electives, and an end-of-term reflection (see details in the Assessments area of Canvas).

But one of the drawbacks of his class is he seldom remind you what is going to happen in the next few lessons. You will only be informed by him a lesson before the Vocab test. So you must stay alert and revise in advance.
